creditline: The Ray and Carol Bergeson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: young girl wearing a polka dotted dress and a white headscarf, leaning against a wall with her PR leg stretched out, with her foot on a stair step
signed: on back in pencil: Graciela Iturbide / copea de eprica / Zihuatangjo 1969 / ACC2006-191
text: Celebrated Mexican photographer Graciela Iturbide is known for her groundbreaking documentary work within indigenous communities throughout Mexico. Bringing a feminist lens to her practice, Iturbide has created a large and varied body of work representing a range of traditions, rituals, and everyday experiences relevant to Mexican women and families. Balanced in their composition, playful in subject matter, striking in their tonal range, these photographs stand as prime examples of Iturbide’s talents as photographer and printer.
title: Zihuatanejo, México
